home.title: $t(global.gameName) - Free Idle MMO Game - Gather, Craft, Battle, Trade, and Cows!
home.subtitle: Multiplayer Idle RPG
home.bannerText: Embark on a journey through the $t(global.gameName) universe, a unique multiplayer idle game. Whether you enjoy resource gathering, item crafting, or engaging in epic battles against alien monsters, we have something to offer for everyone. Immerse yourself in our thriving community, where you can trade in the player-driven marketplace, form a guild with friends, chat with fellow players, or climb to the top of the leaderboards!

tutorialQuest.welcomeStartText:
Welcome to $t(global.gameName) - a world with magical cows!

I'm Purple, the Chief Training Officer (CTO), and also your tour guide today!

I'll cast an orange glow to guide you through the training.
tutorialQuest.milkCowStartText:
Let me first show you what we magical cows are best known for: producing magical milk! By the way, my cousin Burble also works here. Hi Burble!

First, try and gather some milk.
tutorialQuest.milkCowCompleteText: Good job! Here's some extra milk and a brush. Magical cows love to be brushed, and happy cows produce milk faster!
tutorialQuest.smithCheeseStartText: Let's make some cheese with the milk! These special cheeses are very durable and can be turned into many useful things through cheesesmithing!
tutorialQuest.smithCheeseCompleteText: Great! Take some extra cheese with you for the next task.
tutorialQuest.smithSwordStartText: Cheeses are essential resources for making tools, weapons, and armor. Let me show you how to make a cheese sword. I know it might sound crazy and maybe a little bit smelly too, but trust me.
tutorialQuest.smithSwordCompleteText: Awesome! As you level up, equipment can be upgraded to higher tiers! Tools can also be made to improve each of your skills.
tutorialQuest.forageFarmlandStartText: Now let's go forage for some more resources. Head to Farmland and see what items you can gather!
tutorialQuest.forageFarmlandCompleteText: That was fast! Foraging gives you resources used in many skills, including cooking, brewing, and tailoring!
tutorialQuest.cookDonutStartText: It's time to make use of your cooking skill and whip up a delicious donut using some eggs, wheat, and sugar. What? You can't cook? Of course you can! There's a rat from Earth that can cook, and if he can do it, so can you! Give it a try!
tutorialQuest.cookDonutCompleteText: Fantastic! Food can heal you while in combat. Here's a dozen more donuts for free!
tutorialQuest.fightFlyStartText: Now I want to take you on an expedition to one of our neighboring planets - the Smelly Planet! I hear there are lots of flies, and they bite! You'll want to bring your sword and some donuts. Let's go!
tutorialQuest.fightFlyCompleteText:
Battling monsters earns you coins, resources, ability books, and even rare items.

If you are knocked out during combat, you will recover in 150 seconds and continue fighting.
tutorialQuest.messageTipsStartText:
Looks like the tour is almost over. There's still much more to explore, but don't worry, you won't be alone! Once you level up a little more, you can chat with or get help from other players!

You can also buy or sell items in our player-driven marketplace, unless you are playing Ironcow mode.
tutorialQuest.messageTips2StartText:
Before I go, here's a few more tips:
- A Game Guide can be found at the bottom of the navigation menu on the left.
- If you go offline, you'll continue to make progress for 10 hours (upgradable).
- Items, abilities, skills, and enemies can be hovered over (long press on mobile) to see more detailed tooltips.

I have to go now. It's time for my second lunch, and I have four stomachs to fill. Now go explore the Milky Way!

reportTypeDescription.harassmentMe: Personal attacks or harassment directed at me.
reportTypeDescription.harassmentOthers: Personal attacks or harassment directed at someone else.
reportTypeDescription.offensiveLanguage: Use of offensive or inappropriate language.
reportTypeDescription.illegalViolentSexual: Message, discussion, or URL link that is illegal, excessively violent, or sexual in nature.
reportTypeDescription.controversialTopics: Divisive topics such as politics, religion, international conflicts, gender discussions, sexuality, mute/ban complaints, or other topics that frequently become disruptive.
reportTypeDescription.excessiveDrama: Excessive drama or heated arguments that disrupt the chat.
reportTypeDescription.spam: Single player spamming chat with meaningless messages, excessive duplicate messages, or begging others for free items. (Multiple players posting similar messages is not considered spam)
reportTypeDescription.encouragingRuleBreaking: Encouraging or misleading other players into breaking game rules.
reportTypeDescription.personalInformation: Disclosing identifying personal information about themselves or any personal information about other players that they have not made public themselves.
reportTypeDescription.wrongChannel: Repeatedly posting messages in the wrong channel.
reportTypeDescription.cheating: Admission of cheating, including but not limited to multi-accounts, boosting, real world trading, botting, or bug abuse.
reportTypeDescription.underage: Admission of being underage, which is defined as 12 years old or younger.
reportTypeDescription.other: Other issues not covered by the above categories.

guideTooltip.milkingContent:
The milks from these magical cows have a wide variety of functions.They can be used to produce consumables or craft into special cheese to make equipment.
Cows love to be brushed. Equipping a brush will boost your milking skill.
guideTooltip.foragingContent:
You can find many different resources while foraging in the various areas.These resources can be used for cooking and brewing consumables.
Equipping shears will boost your foraging skill.
guideTooltip.woodcuttingContent:
You can gather logs from different types of trees.Logs are used for crafting various equipments.
Equipping a hatchet will boost your woodcutting skill.
guideTooltip.cheesesmithingContent:
The hardened cheeses made with milks from the magical cows are as tough as metal.You can smith them into equipment that gives you bonuses in combat or skilling.
Equipment is upgradable from one tier to the next, often requiring increasing amount of cheese.There is also special equipment that can be crafted with items found from monsters in combat.
Equipping a hammer will boost your cheesesmithing skill.
guideTooltip.craftingContent:
You can craft weapons, offhands, and jewelry.
Equipping a chisel will boost your crafting skill.
guideTooltip.tailoringContent:
You can tailor ranged and magic clothing using raw materials gathered from combat and foraging.
Equipping a needle will boost your tailoring skill.
guideTooltip.cookingContent:
Food can be used to recover your HP or MP.They can be brought with you to combat.
Equipping a spatula will boost your cooking skill.
guideTooltip.brewingContent:
Drinks can provide you with temporary buffs.Coffee can be brought with you to combat and tea can be used while skilling.
Equipping a pot will boost your brewing skill.
guideTooltip.alchemyContent:
Alchemy allows you to transform items into other items.Each alchemy action has a different success rate, and the input items will always be consumed regardless of success or failure.
Coinify: Converts item into coins.Decompose: Converts item into component materials.Transmute: Converts item into a random related item, and in some cases unique items that cannot be acquired elsewhere.
Each transformation has a base success rate.The success rate is lower if your alchemy level is lower than the item level.Catalyst and tea can be used to increase the success rate.
Equipping an Alembic will boost your alchemy skill.
guideTooltip.enhancingContent:
Enhancing allows you to permanently improve your equipment, giving them increasing bonuses as their enhancement level go up.
Enhancing costs a small amount of materials for each attempt.The success rate depends on your enhancing skill level, the tier of the equipment, and the equipment's current enhancement level.A successful enhancement will increase the level by 1 and failure will reset the level back to 0.
You can optionally use copies of the base equipment for protection.Failure with protection will only reduce the enhancement level by 1 but consume 1 protection item.
Equipping an enhancer will boost your enhancing success.
guideTooltip.combatContent:
Fighting monsters will earn you experience and item drops.Your combat stats are based on a combination of your combat skill levels and your equipment bonuses.
You can bring food to recover HP or MP, drinks to give you buffs, and abilities that can be cast.You can change the automation configuration from the settings icon below them.
If you are defeated in combat, your character will wait through a respawn timer before automatically continuing combat.
guideTooltip.marketplaceContent:
The marketplace allows players to make buy or sell listings for any tradable item.You can click on any item listed to view existing listings or to create your own.
New listings will always be fulfilled by the best matching prices on market when possible.If no immediate fulfillment is possible, the listing will appear on the marketplace.
When a trade is successful, a tax of 2% coins is taken and the received items can be collected from "My Listings" tab.Asks: existing sell listings.Bids: existing buy listings.
guideTooltip.combatStatsContent:
Attack Interval: How fast you can auto-attack.
Ability Haste: Reduces ability cooldown.
Accuracy: Increases chance to successfully attack.
Damage: Auto-attack damage is random between 1 and the maximum damage.
Critical Hit: Always rolls maximum damage. Ranged style has passive critical chance.
Task Damage: Increases damage to monsters assigned as tasks.
Amplify: Increases damage of that type.
Evasion: Increases chance to dodge an attack.
Armor: Mitigates % of physical damage.
Resistance: Mitigates % of elemental damage.
Penetration: Ignores % of enemy armor/resistance.
Life Steal: Heal for % of auto-attack.
Mana Leech: Leeches for % of auto-attack.
Thorn: When attacked, reflects a percentage of your armor or resistance (corresponding to the attack type) as damage back to the attacker.
Tenacity: Reduces chance of being blinded, silenced, or stunned.
Threat: Increases chance of being targeted by monsters.
HP Regen: Recover % of Max HP per 10s.
MP Regen: Recover % of Max MP per 10s.
Food Haste: Reduces food cooldown.
Drink Concentration: Increases drink effect. Reduces duration and cooldown.
Combat Drop Rate: Increase regular item drop rate.
Combat Rare Find: Increase rare item drop rate.
guideTooltip.noncombatStatsContent:
Speed: Increases action speed
Task Speed: Increases speed on actions assigned as tasks.
Gathering Quantity: Increases gathering quantity
Efficiency: Chance of repeating the action instantly
Skilling Essence Find: Increases chance of finding essences
Skilling Rare Find: Increase rare item drop rate.
guideTooltip.abilitiesContent:
Abilities can be learned from ability books.You can acquire ability books as drops from monsters or purchase them from other players in the marketplace.
Abilities can be placed into slots to be used in combat.You unlock more slots as your intelligence skill level increases.
Abilities can level up as you gain experience.You get 0.1 experience for every use in combat and a much larger amount from consuming duplicate ability books.
guideTooltip.houseContent:
Rooms in your house can be built to give you permanent bonuses.
Each room can be leveled up to a maximum of level 8 with increasing costs.
guideTooltip.loadoutsContent:
Loadouts allow you to save your current equipment, consumables, and abilities to be automatically loaded later with actions.Loadouts can be tied to a single skill or "All Skills."Selecting "All Skills" will only save equipment.
Setting a loadout as default will auto-select the loadout when choosing any action in the skill(s) the loadout is associated with.
guideTooltip.enhancingProtectionContent: One protection item is consumed on failure to ensure that only 1 enhancement level is lost instead of being reset to 0.
guideTooltip.alchemyCatalystContent: Catalyst increases success rate.One catalyst is consumed per success.

1747609200000.heading: Medium Patch - MooPass and Other News
1747609200000.content:
The MooPass is here, an optional membership that provides a variety of helpful but non-essential perks! All characters can claim 14 days of MooPass for free, and an additional 14 days have been granted to all existing characters. For more details, check out the Patch Notes or directly in Cowbell Store.

As with any new form of monetization, we understand there are concerns about the game's future direction and the potential for pay-to-win. We want to reassure you that we have no plans to introduce any monetization that could be considered predatory. We've carefully considered community feedback and designed the MooPass to be affordable and fair for both paying and free-to-play players. It introduces no content paywalls and has no impact on core gameplay, ensuring a level playing field. By offering recurring value, MooPass also helps maintain demand for Cowbells beyond one-time convenience upgrades and cosmetics, which supports the long-term sustainability of Milky Way Idle.

In other news, the continued growth of our playerbase has posed new challenges for our moderation team. Our current system depends on volunteer moderators actively monitoring the in-game chat. We've seen feedback both regarding moderation strictness and inappropriate messages being missed during low-coverage times. To address this, we're developing a new system that will rely more heavily on player reports, giving players more control over their chat experience. For example, when moderators are unavailable, messages that receive enough reports will be subject to automated moderation. This also allows our moderators to take a less proactive role and instead focus on messages that have been flagged by the community. We expect to release this system within the next week or two.

Lastly, a reminder to follow our rules regarding the single-account policy and trade boosting. With many new players joining, some may not be familiar with our stance on funenlng wealth from alt accounts or coin purchases from gold sellers. We regularly conduct ban waves. For example, over the past couple of weeks, we've issued temporary or permanent bans to 500+ main accounts and thousands of alt accounts. Players receiving temp bans also had 2â€“3x the boosted wealth removed, totaling over 100 billion coins. Cheating is not worth the risk, and we will continue to improve our detection systems.

1744930800000.heading: Pirate Cove Dungeon, 4th Character Slot, and Custom Cosmetic Policy Update
1744930800000.content:
The Pirate Cove Dungeon is now open for exploration! This new dungeon features a variety of new T95 weapons and armors, as well as new abilities. We've also made some adjustments to existing items and abilities to improve balance and gameplay. Check out the full patch notes for all the details!

In other news, we've added a new 4th character slot for players, allowing everyone the same opportunity of having up to 1 Standard and 3 Ironcow characters.

We are also updating our custom cosmetic policy and pricing. While the feature started as nice gift to show our appreciation to our supporters, it's now too overwhelming with the huge increase in playerbase. We've spent 150-200 hours to work on about 100 requests in the past month, and we need to be able to allocate more time for other development tasks. Starting May 1st, custom cosmetics will require spending supporter points and cowbells. Any requests initiated before the end of April will be granted based on the previous supporter point requirements.

1734825600000.heading: Skilling Expansion Part 2 - Celestial Tools and Skilling Outfits
1734825600000.content: We're excited to release the second part of the skilling expansion, introducing Celestial Tools and Skilling Outfits! After using Holy tools for such a long time, skilling specialists can finally get their hands on some upgrades. These items are not easy to acquire, but those who are dedicated (or wealthy) enough to obtain them will be rewarded with a significant boost. Dive in and take your skilling to the next level!

1749250800000.heading: Medium Patch - Chat Report System and QOL Improvements
1749250800000.content:
Features and Content:
  1. Chat Report System: Players can now report rule-breaking messages in the chat.
    1. Reports are sent to moderators for review and potential action.
    2. Automod may be applied to messages that receive enough reports. Penalty can still be adjusted after manual review.
    3. Sending correct reports will increase the weight of your future reports and incorrect reports will significantly reduce it.
  2. You can now delete character in Settings.
  3. Added special icons (Contributor, Bug Finder, etc) that can be granted to players for significant contributions. They will display as a second icon.
QOL:
  1. You can now reorder action queues.
  2. You can now link market listings in chat. This should improve trade chat experience with different languages.
Other:
  1. Added official market data that can be accessed at https://www.milkywayidle.com/game_data/marketplace.json. This is updated every 6 hours (with some randomness and delay to prevent manipulation) and contains a snapshot of the top ask and bid prices for each item.
  2. Removed @mod command from the chat as it is no longer needed.
  3. Server optimizations to improve backend performance and support additional players.

1747609200000.heading: Medium Patch - MooPass and Other Improvements
1747609200000.content:
Features and Content:
  1. MooPass: an optional membership that grants a number of helpful but non-essential perks.
    1. Available for purchase in the Cowbell Store with either Cowbells or real money.
    2. All characters can claim 14 days of MooPass for free. Additional 14 days granted to all existing characters.
    3. +5% XP buff. This is limited to Standard characters only to allow Ironcow characters to not be significantly affected by paid content.
    4. +10 Hour Offline Progress Limit
    5. +6 Market Listing Limit
    6. +1 Action Queue Limit
    7. +8 Task Slot Limit
    8. +1 Free Task Reroll (per task)
    9. Loot Tracker of last 20 activities. This is found below the Cowbell Store in the menu.
    10. Golden Avatar Border
Steam:
  1. Updated Steam client and moved local save data to a more stable file location. For the first time after patching, wou may need to re-login and reconfigure extensions.
QOL:
  1. Market listing max price increased from 10B to 100B.
  2. Market listing prices that are in shortened format will now be color coded based on their primary unit (K, M, B, T) to reduce chance of misreading prices.
  3. Added /r chat command to reply to the last whisper.
  4. Added stricter spam protection for excessive duplicate chat messages from 1 or more players.
Bug Fixes:
  1. Fixed issue where enhancing essence drop rate was 33% lower than displayed. (I buffed it at some point but only updated the client and forgot the backend)
  2. Fixed issue with unread whispers count not showing up when reentering the game.
  3. Cheese type Plate Body Auto Attack Damage now correctly match Plate Legs bonuses. Special equipment are unaffected.
  4. Correctly translate party chat links for Chinese language.
  5. Allow leaderboard tabs on mobile to wrap to second line so the Steam categories do not cause display overflow.
Other:
  1. Removed seasonal Anniversary Purple and OG Jerry chat icons.
  2. Removed Brown/White Key Fragment exchange from the dungeon shop as it was meant to be temporary.
  3. Market taxes now round up instead of round down to reduce monopolization of low-value item trading.

1744930800000.heading: Major Patch - Pirate Cove Dungeon and More
1744930800000.content:
Features and Content:
  1. Pirate Cove Dungeon:
    1. New T95 Magic Weapons: Rippling Trident, Blooming Trident, Blazing Trident.
    2. New T95 Armors: Anchorbound Plate Body/Legs, Maelstrom Plate Body/Legs, Kraken Tunic/Chaps, Corsair Helmet, Marksman Bracers.
    3. New Abilities: Shield Bash (also added to Chimerical Den), Fracturing Impact, Life Drain.
    4. Alchemy recipes added for the new items. All dungeon ability book transmutes have been normalized to 50% success.
  2. Furious Spear: New T95 spear added to Enchanted Fortress.
  3. Upgrading equipment with production skills will now save 70% of the enhancement levels. Some T95 equipment recipes are adjusted to be upgraded from lower tier variants.
  4. Added 4th character slot. You can only have up to 3 Ironcows.
  5. Added Steam leaderboard for characters created after the Steam release and is also linked to Steam. This is only visible on qualifying characters.
  6. Increased guild member slots from 25 + level/4 to 30 + level/3.
Cosmetics:
  1. Seasonal(2 year anniversary): Anniversary Purple, OG Jerry chat icons.
  2. Added new chat icons based on a small selection of dungeon bosses.
  3. Added 2 new Pirate Cove themed avatars and outfits.
  4. Custom cosmetics are changed to require spending supporter points and cowbells. We are simply overwhelmed by requests due to the huge increase in player count and unfortunately cannot continue supporting them as gifts. The new pricing will take effect on May 1st. Any requests initiated before end of April will be granted based on the previous supporter point requirements.
Rebalancing:
  1. Adjusted recipe of Chimerical Chest Key and Enchanted Chest Key so that their Brown and White Key Fragments are swapped. This prevents Enchanted Fortress and Pirate Cove from sharing 3/4 key fragments. You can temporarily freely swap between Brown and White Key Fragments in the dungeon shop until the next patch.
  2. Added auto attack damage to all melee armor to bring melee damage closer to the other styles.
  3. Increased bulwark accuracy and damage
  4. Added melee accuracy to Colossus Plate Body/Legs
  5. Crippling Slash: Reworked to damage all enemies.
  6. Maim: Damaged over time duration reduced from 15s to 9s. Damage taken debuff increased from 0% to 8%.
  7. Frost Surge: Evasion debuff lowered from 15% to 10%.
  8. Firestorm: Damage over time duration reduced from 10s to 6s.
  9. Smoke Burst: Accuracy debuff lowered from 20% to 15%. Evasion debuff increased from 0% to 15%.
  10. Golem Cave: Monster defense level reduced by 10-20.
  11. Twilight Zone: Monster fire resistance reduced by 20.
UI:
  1. Added a new setting to hide General chat system messages.
  2. Disabled party linking in General, Trade, and Beginner chat.
  3. Added double confirmation to some buttons that are troublesome when misclicked.
  4. Added inactive days count to guild and friend list.
  5. Changed "Start" button text on alchemy and enhancing to be more obvious about what action it is.
Bug Fixes:
  1. Do not prevent making an instant market order when you have 3 open listings on the item.
  2. Fixed issue that may cause small number of player's actions to stop after a server restart.
  3. Fixed a rare bug that may cause server crash.
Other:
  1. Blocking characters will prevent party join (based on leader) and guild invite.
  2. Server and client optimizations to speed up server restart, task generation, scroll performance, and more.
  3. Added a feature to allow admin to post an announcement bar for important messages.
  4. Localization improvements.

1741906800000.heading: Minor Patch - Anti-Fraud Measures and Bug Fixes
1741906800000.content:
Anti-Fraud:
  1. Due to a few instances of recent fraudulent purchases, added anti-fraud measure where player's first time Cowbell purchase may trigger a 72-hour restriction on selling Bags of Cowbells on the market. You will be notified prior to purchasing.
Bug Fix:
  1. Fixed an issue where under extremely rare conditions a player may get stuck in a nonexistent party combat action.
  2. Fixed additional translation inconsistencies with some item names and their corresponding actions.
Other:
  1. Backend changes to improve database connection stability.

1740913200000.heading: Major Patch - Chinese Localization and Final Preparations for Steam Early Access Release
1740913200000.content:
UI:
  1. Added Chinese localization.
    1. The language will be automatically selected based on your browser language.
    2. Players can also manually change the display language in [Settings] -> [Game] or from the home page.
    3. A few items have not yet been translated, including most of news/patch notes, terms of use, and privacy policy.
    4. If you see any translation issues or bugged display text, please report them in the #bug-reports channel on Discord.
  2. Updated popup modals to all be centered on the entire game screen.
Other:
  1. Removed seasonal Spring Festival cosmetics from the Cowbell Store.
  2. Additional adjustments to Steam integration.
  3. Privacy policy have been updated to include language for use of analytical and marketing cookies. This allows us to optimize marketing campaigns when attempting to run ads for Milky Way Idle on other platforms.

1737885600000.heading: Minor Patch
1737885600000.content:
Spring Festival:
  1. Spring festival chat icon, avatar, and avatar outfits available in Cowbell Store until the update after at least 3 weeks. You can continue to use them after the event ends.
UI:
  1. Send a system message every 25 skill levels at or above level 100 instead of only for levels 100 and 125.
Bug Fix:
  1. Leaderboard guild names should not be clickable.
  2. Improved chat message URL link parsing to be more accurate.
  3. Fixed an issue where players get logged out if the database goes offline during maintenance.
  4. Fixed an issue where some uncommon conditions cause player combat to not correctly stop after running out of offline progress.
Other:
  1. Added @mod and @mods chat commands to notify moderators for emergencies.
  2. Implemented authentication and payment changes in the background to support upcoming Steam release.

gameGuideContent.faqContent:
General Q: How does offline progress work? A: Your character continues to make progress even when you're offline. A new player gets up to 10 hours of offline progress anytime you close the browser or go offline. You can extend this time with convenience upgrades available in the Cowbell Store. Q: Can I log in from another device? A: If you have registered an account, you can log in from any device using your email and password. If you are playing as a guest, you can find your guest password in Settings and use it to log in with your username. Q: Can I play the game without an internet connection or as a single player? A: No, you must be connected to the internet to play the game. However, you do continue to make progress while offline for up to 10 hours by default. If you prefer to not interact with other players, you can collapse the chat and choose not to use the marketplace. Q: Can I change my username? A: Yes, you can change your username by going to the Cowbell Store and clicking on the "Name Change" tab. It costs 500 cowbells to change your username. Q: How can I get a chat icon or different name color? A: You can purchase a chat icon or name color from the Cowbell Store using cowbells. You can change your displayed icon and color in Settings. Q: How do I send a private message to another player? A: To send a private message to another player, click on their name next to their chat message and click "Whisper". You can also use the chat command "/w player_name chat_message". Q: How do I block another player? A: To block a player and stop seeing their chat messages, click on their name next to their message and click "Block". You can also use the chat command "/block player_name". You can find your block list in the Settings menu and unblock players from the list. Gameplay Q: What is the action queue? A: The action queue is a feature that allows you to set up a sequence of actions for your character to perform. To use it, click the "Add Queue" button instead of "Start". Queue slots can be unlocked or upgraded from the Cowbell Store. Q: What are cowbells and how can I get more? A: Cowbells are the premium currency of the game. They allow players to purchase convenience upgrades, cosmetics, community buffs that benefit the whole server, and name changes. There are three ways to get Cowbells:
  • Finish the tutorial: You will receive 80 cowbells as a reward.
  • Rare drops: You have a chance to get cowbells from rare loot boxes found while skilling or battling enemies in combat.
  • Purchase from Cowbell Store: You can purchase cowbells with real money from the Cowbell Store to help support the game.
  • Buy from the marketplace: You can buy tradable "Bag of 10 Cowbells" with coins from other players in the Marketplace.
 Q: What are rare drops? A: Rare drops are loot boxes that can be obtained while engaging in different activities in the game:
  • Gathering skills: You get meteorite caches which contain star fragments.
  • Production skills, alchemy, and enhancing: You get artisan's crates which contain shards of protection and gems.
  • Combat: You get treasure chests which contain gems.
All boxes also contain coins and occasionally cowbells. You get larger boxes when doing higher level skills or from higher level enemies. Q: What are gems used for? A: Gems can be used to craft different jewelry that gives small bonuses. Additionally, you can crush gems into smaller pieces with the Crafting skill and use them to brew stronger versions of coffee and tea. Gems can be obtained from treasure chests in combat. Q: Where do I get tea leaves? A: You can get tea leaves from defeating enemies in combat. When viewing combat zones, you can hover over an enemy (long press on mobile) to see what items it drops. Tea leaves are an essential ingredient for brewing tea, which can buff non-combat skills. Q: What are essences? A: Essences are used to enhance special equipment with the Enhancing skill. Enemies from each combat zone drop a different type of essence.
gameGuideContent.gatheringContent:
Milking Milking magical cows yields different types of milk, which can be used in a various ways:
  • Cheesesmithing: Milk can be turned into cheese, which can then be used to craft melee equipment or skilling tools.
  • Cooking: Milk is an essential ingredient for many recipes.
  • Brewing: Milk is used in a small number of coffee and tea recipes.
 You can help magical cows produce milk faster by equipping a brush.
Foraging Foraging allows you to gather different resources from various areas. You can forage for a specific item in an area or forage the entire area to get a bit of everything. Foraged resources can be used in:
  • Cooking: Eggs, wheat, sugar, berries, and fruits are essential ingredients for many recipes.
  • Brewing: Berries, fruits, and coffee beans are used to brew coffee and tea.
  • Tailoring: Flax, bamboo branches, cocoons, and other materials can be processed into fabric to make magical clothing.
 You can increase foraging speed by equipping shears.
Woodcutting You can chop logs from different kinds of trees. Logs can be used in:
  • Cheesesmithing: Logs are part of the recipe for making a number of melee weapons and skilling tools.
  • Crafting: Logs can be processed into lumber to craft ranged and magic weapons.
 You can increase woodcutting speed by equipping a hatchet.
Level Bonus You gain 1% efficiency bonus for each level you have above the action's level requirement.
gameGuideContent.productionContent:
Cheesesmithing Cheesesmithing is the process of creating melee equipment and skilling tools. Milk is processed into different tiers of cheese. The cheese is then used (sometimes in combination with other resources) to craft equipment. Equipment can be upgraded into higher tiers as you level up. You can increase cheesesmithing speed by equipping a hammer.
Crafting Crafting produces a variety of items, including ranged and magic weapons, jewelry, and other special resources. Logs can be processed into different tiers of lumber, which is then used to craft ranged and magic weapons. Jewelry can be crafted using star fragments and gems, which are rare drops found while gathering or from combat. You can increase crafting speed by equipping a chisel.
Tailoring Tailoring produces ranged and magic clothing as well as pouches. Raw resources from foraging, such as flax, bamboo branches, and cocoons, can be processed into fabric. Hides from combat enemies can also be processed into leather. Fabric is primarily used to make magic clothing, such as robes and hats, while leather is used to make ranged clothing, such as leather armor and boots. In addition to clothing, you can craft pouches which increase your maximum HP and MP in combat. Pouches also provide additional consumable slots for both skilling and combat. You can increase sewing speed by equipping a needle.
Cooking Cooking produces food that can be used during combat. Donuts and cakes restore HP, while gummies and yogurt restore MP. You can increase cooking speed by equipping a spatula.
Brewing Brewing produces drinks that provide buffs with limited durations. Coffee can be consumed during combat to improve combat-related stats, while tea can be consumed to improve non-combat skills. You can increase brewing speed by equipping a pot.
Level Bonus You gain 1% efficiency bonus for each level you have above the action's level requirement.
gameGuideContent.alchemyContent:
Alchemy Alchemy allows you to transform items into other items using the actions Coinify, Decompose, or Transmute. Each action has a different success rate, and the input item and coin cost will always be consumed regardless of success or failure.
Coinify Coinify lets you to convert items into coins. The amount of coins received is 5 times the item's sell price. The base success rate is 70%.
Decompose Decompose lets you to break down items. Equipment can be turned into their base components, and non-equipment items can be turned into skilling essences. Decomposing enhanced equipment yields bonus enhancing essences, with the quantity doubling for each enhancement level. The base success rate is 60%.
Transmute Transmute lets you to change items into other related items or rare uniques, such as the Philosopher's Stone. The base success rate varies depending on the item being transmuted.
Success Rates The base success rate depends on the alchemy action and the specific item being alchemized. If your Alchemy skill level is lower than the item's level, there will be a penalty to the success rate. The success rate can be increased by using catalysts and catalytic tea.
Catalysts Catalysts are special items that can be used to improve the success rates of Alchemy actions. One catalyst is consumed on success only. Regular catalysts can be crafted using skilling essences. Prime catalysts can be obtained by transmuting regular catalysts.
Alchemy Efficiency You gain 1% efficiency bonus for each level you have above the item's recommended level.
Instructions Here is a list of steps to follow when alchemizing items:
  1. Select the item that you want to alchemize.
  2. Select the alchemy action that you want to perform.
  3. Decide whether or not to use a catalyst. If you do, select the catalyst.
  4. Click the "Start" button and the alchemy process will begin.
gameGuideContent.enhancingContent:
Enhancing Enhancing is the process of increasing the stats of any equipment, such as armor, weapons, tools, pouches, or jewelry. When you successfully enhance an equipment, its enhancement level increases by 1. However, if the enhancement process fails, the level is reset to 0.
Success Rate The success rate of enhancing depends on several factors, including your enhancing skill level, the tier of the equipment, and the equipment's current enhancement level. Generally, the higher the tier and enhancement level of the equipment, the lower the success rate will be. Equipping an enhancer can improve your success rate.
Protection The protection mechanic is a feature that allows players to use copies of the base equipment, mirrors of protection, or crafting components (for special equipment only) to add protection to each enhancing attempt. If the enhancement fails, the equipment's level is only decreased by 1, but 1 protection item is consumed. This can be a cost-effective way to reach high enhancement levels for endgame players.
Enhancing Speed You gain 1% action speed bonus for each level you have above the item's recommended level.
Instructions Here is a list of steps to follow when enhancing equipment:
  1. Select the piece of equipment that you want to enhance.
  2. Set the target enhancement level that you would like to stop at. Be realistic about what level you can reach with your current resources.
  3. Decide whether or not to use protection. If you do then select the protection item and a minimum enhancement level where protection will be used. Generally, protection is more cost-effective when the item is at higher enhancement levels.
  4. Click the "Start" button and you will continue enhancing until you reach the target level or run out of materials.

Enhancement Bonus The bonus stats on enhanced equipment are a percentage of the base stats. The total bonus at each enhancement level is as follows:
+1: 2.0%
+2: 4.2%
+3: 6.6%

+11: 33.0%

+13: 41.6%
+14: 46.2%
+15: 51.0%
+16: 56.0%
+17: 61.2%
+18: 66.6%
+19: 72.2%
+20: 78.0% As an exception, jewelry and back slot enhancements receives 5x the normal bonus. For instance, a +1 enhancement on jewelry is a 10% bonus.
Enhancement Base Success Rate +1: 50%
+2: 45%
+3: 45%
+4: 40%
+5: 40%

+15: 30%

+18: 30%
+19: 30%
+20: 30%
gameGuideContent.combatContent:
Combat Fighting aliens can earn you coins, tea leaves, hides, essences, ability books, gems, and special items, as well as more common resources. There are enemies of varying difficulty located in different combat areas.
Equipment Wearing equipment will boost your stats in combat. You can equip items directly from the inventory or by clicking equipment slots in the equipment tab next to the inventory.
Consumables Food can be consumed to recover your HP or MP. Drinks provide limited duration buffs. Upgrading your pouch allows you to carry more food and drinks into battle.
Abilities You can learn abilities and use them in combat at the cost of MP. To unlock new abilities, you must learn them from ability books. Abilities get stronger as you level them up. You gain 0.1 XP every time it's used in combat. You can also gain a large amount of XP by consuming duplicate ability books. When multiple abilities are available for use during combat, they will be prioritized in the same order you have set them. Your Intelligence level determines how many abilities you can bring with you.
Combat Triggers Both consumables and abilities have default settings for when they will be automatically used. The settings are referred to as combat triggers, and they can be modified by clicking the gear icon below before entering the battle.
Defeat and Respawning When defeated in combat, your character will have to wait through a respawn timer before fully recovering and resuming combat automatically.
Group Combat You can create or join a party to battle in zones with multiple monsters. When all party members have pressed "Ready," the party will automatically travel to battle. Monsters will randomly attack any of the party members, and those with a higher threat stat will be targeted more frequently. Monster drops will be divided with an equal chance among all players.
Dungeons Dungeons consists of multiple waves of higher tier elite monsters and unique dungeon bosses. They can be accessed with dungeon keys, which can be crafted after finding key fragments from bosses in regular combat zones. Up to five players can be in a dungeon party. Each person must have a key, which will be consumed after beating the final boss for the dungeon reward chest. If you complete a dungeon with fewer players, you will have a chance of looting an additional chest at the cost of an extra key. If the dungeon is not completed, you will keep your dungeon key. Deaths in dungeons will not trigger a respawn timer. You can only be revived by a party member. If all party members are dead, the dungeon run is considered failed and you will restart at wave 1.
Skills You have 7 combat skills that can be leveled up:
  • Stamina: Increases max HP by 10 per level. You gain experience mainly from taking damage and slightly from avoiding damage.
  • Intelligence: Increases max MP by 10 per level. You gain experience when consuming mana while using abilities.
  • Attack: Increases your melee accuracy and base attack speed. You gain experience when dealing melee damage, with more experience gained from stab and less from smash.
  • Power: Increases your melee damage. You gain experience when dealing melee damage, with more experience gained from smash and less from stab.
  • Defense: Increases your evasion, armor, and elemental resistances. You gain experience when dodging or mitigating damage.
  • Ranged: Increases your ranged accuracy, ranged damage, and magic evasion. Ranged attacks can critical strike. You gain experience when dealing ranged damage.
  • Magic: Increases your magic accuracy, magic damage, and elemental resistances. You gain experience when dealing magic damage.

Status Effects There are status effects that can temporarily prevent you from taking certain actions:
  • Blind: Prevents using auto attacks.
  • Silence: Prevents using abilities.
  • Stun: Prevents using auto attacks, abilities, and consumables.

Stats You also have secondary combat stats that are affected by your skill levels, equipment, and buffs:
  • Combat style: Each attack has a specific style - stab, slash, smash, ranged, or magic.
  • Damage Type: Each attack deals a specific type of damage - physical, water, nature, or fire.
  • Attack Interval: How fast you can auto-attack.
  • Ability Haste: Reduces ability cooldown.
  • Accuracy: Increases your chance to successfully attack.
  • Damage: The maximum damage if an attack is successful. Auto-attack damage is random between 1 and the maximum damage.
  • Critical Hit: Critical hits always rolls maximum damage. Ranged style has passive critical chance.
  • Amplify: Increases the damage you deal.
  • Penetration: Ignores a percentage of enemy armor or resistance when attacking.
  • Evasion: Increases your chance to dodge an attack.
  • Armor: Mitigates a percentage of physical damage.
  • Resistance: Mitigates a percentage of water, nature, or fire damage.
  • Life Steal: Heals you based on the percentage of auto-attack damage you deal.
  • Mana Leech: Leeches mana based on the percentage of auto-attack damage you deal.
  • Thorn: When attacked, reflects a percentage of your armor or resistance (corresponding to the attack type) as damage back to the attacker.
  • Tenacity: Reduces chance of being blinded, silenced, or stunned.
  • Threat: Increases chance of being targeted by monsters.
  • HP/MP Regen: Recovers a percentage of your maximum HP/MP every 10 seconds.
  • Food Haste: Reduces food cooldown.
  • Drink Concentration: Increases drink effect. Reduces duration and cooldown.
  • Combat Drop Rate: Increases the drop rate of regular items. This cannot go above 100%.
  • Combat Drop Quantity: Increases quantity of regular item drops.
  • Combat Rare Find: Increases rare item drop rate.
  • Combat Level: This is only for display and represents your overall combat effectiveness based on the combination of combat skill levels.

Formulas For those who enjoy math, here are the formulas for the secondary stats:
  • Max HP = 10 * (10 + Stamina)
  • Max MP = 10 * (10 + Intelligence)
  • Attack Interval = baseInterval / (1 + (Attack / 2000)) / (1 + AttackSpeedBonus)
  • Ability Cooldown = baseCooldown * 100 / (100 + abilityHaste)
  • Accuracy = (10 + [Attack|Ranged|Magic]) * (1 + Bonus%)
  • Damage = (10 + [Power|Ranged|Magic]) * (1 + Bonus%)
  • Hit Chance = (MyAccuracy ^ 1.4) / (MyAccuracy ^ 1.4 + EnemyEvasion ^ 1.4)
  • Ranged Bonus Critical Rate = 0.3 * Hit Chance
  • Non-Magic Evasion = (10 + Defense) * (1 + Bonus%)
  • Magic Evasion = (10 + 0.75 * Defense + 0.25 * Ranged) * (1 + Bonus%)
  • Armor = 0.2 * Defense + Bonus
  • Percent Physical Damage Taken = 100 / (100 + Armor)
    If Armor is negative then it's = (100 - Armor) / 100
  • Resistance = 0.1 * (Defense + Magic) + Bonus
  • Percent Elemental Damage Taken = 100 / (100 + Resistance)
    If Resistance is negative then it's = (100 - Resistance) / 100
  • Blind/Silence/Stun Chance = Base Chance * 100 / (100 + Tenacity)
  • Targeted By Monster Chance = MyThreat / (TeamTotalThreat)
  • Combat Level = 0.2 * (Stamina + Intelligence + Defense) + 0.4 * MAX(0.5 * (Attack + Power), Ranged, Magic)
gameGuideContent.tasksContent:
Tasks Feature After completing the tutorial, you will unlock the tasks feature. The Task Board generates random short to medium-length tasks in different skills. By completing these tasks, you can obtain rewards for your participation.
Task Board
  • Frequency: Tasks are assigned periodically, starting at one every 8 hours. Upgrades can reduce the interval to as low as 4 hours.
  • Variety: Tasks may involve gathering/production skills or defeating monsters. The generated tasks will slightly prioritize skills in which the player has a higher level.
  • Rerolls: You can reroll tasks using coins or cowbells. The cost doubles (up to a limit) with each reroll.
  • Capacity: Tasks do not expire, but there's a limit of 8 task slots. The capacity can be increased through upgrades in the cowbell store.
Rewards
  • Completing tasks rewards you with Coins and Task Tokens. A Task Point is also granted for every Task Token rewarded from tasks.
  • Accumulating 50 Task Points allows you to claim "Purple's Gift," which can be opened to obtain Coins, Task Tokens, Task Crystals, and various lootboxes.
Task Shop Task Tokens can be spent in the Task Shop for permanent upgrades or items, including:
  • Task Cooldown: Reduces the cooldown between tasks.
  • Block Slots: Allows blocking specific skills from being assigned as tasks. Combat blocking has to be unlocked at an additional cost.
  • Task Crystals: Used for crafting or upgrading task badge with the Crafting skill. Task badges provide multiplicative action speed or damage bonuses while undertaking tasks.
  • Lootboxes: Large Meteorite Cache, Large Artisan's Crate, and Large Treasure Chest.
gameGuideContent.guildContent:
Guild Discover guilds by navigating to the "Guild" feature in the navigation menu. Guilds are formed by groups of players who enjoy playing together. While guilds currently serve as primarily social hubs, upcoming expansions may introduce more group-oriented activities.
Creating a Guild You can start your own guild by investing 5 million coins and choosing a unique guild name. As the guild's creator, you automatically assume the role of the leader, granting you the highest authority within the guild. Afterward, invite other players to join your guild.
Joining a Guild You can be invited to join existing guilds. To find a guild to join, you can use the Recruit chat channel, where guilds actively seek new members. You can view your invitations on the Guild page.
Guild Features Guilds come with several key features:
  • Guild Chat Channel: A private, self-moderated space for guild members to connect and converse.
  • Guild Notice Board: A persistent message board editable by the leader or generals to keep everyone informed.
  • Guild Levels: As members earn experience points (XP) in various skills, the guild accumulates XP at a 1:1000 ratio, contributing to the guild's level. Climb the leaderboard based on your guild's level and experience.
  • Member Slots: Guilds begin with {{defaultGuildMemberCount}} member slots and gain 1 additional slot for every {{guildLevelsPerMaxMember}} guild levels.
Member Roles Guilds have a structured hierarchy with different roles and permissions. Higher rank roles automatically possess the permission of any lower rank:
  • Leader
    • Can pass leadership to another member.
    • Has the authority to disband the guild entirely when the guild is empty.
  • General
    • Empowered to promote or demote any lower-ranking member.
    • Can edit the guild notice board.
  • Officer
    • Can invite new members to join the guild.
    • Can kick lower-ranking member out of the guild.
  • Member
    • Can view the guild overview.
    • Can view and converse in the guild chat channel.
  • Invited
    • Has no access until they accept the guild invitation
gameGuideContent.chatCommandsContent:
Chat Commands /w [name] [message] - whisper another player
/r - reply to last whisper
/profile [name] - view player profile
/friend [name] - add friend
/block [name] - block player

gameRulesText.content:
The rules for Milky Way Idle are designed to ensure an enjoyable and fair experience for all players. Breaking the rules would result in appropriate penalties dependent on the type and severity of the offense. Penalties include verbal warning, mute, item removal, trading ban, or account ban.

  • Account
    1. Single Account Only: Each person can only play on 1 account. Guests are also considered accounts.
    2. No Account Sharing: Do not share account with other players.
    3. No Inappropriate Name: Names should not be offensive, sexual, impersonating others, or based on well-known real-world individuals. Inappropriate name may result in mutes and forced name change.
    4. Age 13+ Only: In compliance with COPPA(Children's Online Privacy Protection Act), you must be at least age 13+ to register and play.
  • Trading
    1. No Real World Trading / Cross-Trading: Do not trade items or services within Milky Way Idle for anything outside of the game.
    2. No Boosting: Do not funnel wealth to other players. Players may receive up to 10M coins in total gifts from others. Wealth transfers over this limit, whether intentional or not, can be treated as boosting. Unintentional transfers (e.g. randomly finding an extremely underpriced item on market) can be removed. Intentional transfers will result in additional penalties based on severity.
    3. No Scamming: Do not use deception or scamming to gain items from other players. Actions will be taken against scammers given sufficient evidence. However, items lost to scams will not be refunded.
    4. Repay Loans Within 7 Days: Loans are at your own risk. Loans not repaid within 7 days can be considered boosting/scamming.
  • Chat
    1. Use Respectful Language: The #1 chat rule is to respect other players. Our goal is to create a friendly community space everyone can enjoy. Please avoid intentionally antagonizing or harassing others. While the occasional use of profanity is not against the rule, please don't do so excessively, especially when directed at other players.
    2. English in General Chat: Please use only English in the General chat channel. Different languages are acceptable in other channels.
    3. No Discrimination: Do not use slurs, slangs, or any offensive phrases that target any person or group of people.
    4. No Illegal or Sexual Topics: Do not link or discuss illegal activities or sexual topics.
    5. Avoid Divisive Topics or Drama: Avoid divisive topics that often lead to drama or conversations inappropriate for public chat. This includes, but is not limited to, politics, religion, international conflicts, gender discussions, sexuality, mute/ban complaints, and other topics that frequently become disruptive.
    6. No Spamming: Do not spam the chat with large number of unnecessary messages, overuse CAPSLOCK, or beg others for free items.
    7. Do Not Encourage Others to Break Rules: Do not mislead or instigate other players into breaking game rules.
    8. Do Not Disclose Personal Information: Do not disclose identifying personal information about yourself, including, but not limited to, your full name, address, phone number, and email address. Furthermore, do not disclose ANY personal information about other players that they have not made public themselves, such as their name, age, or location.
    9. All Advertisements Must be in Appropriate Channels: All buying, selling, or service requests should be in trade chat. Guild/Party recruitment or seeking to join guild/party requests should be in recruit channel. Price checks are allowed in general or beginner chat. No referral links.
    10. Listen to Moderators: Moderators have the discretion to moderate chat as they see fit in order to maintain a positive environment. Please cooperate with their requests. If anyone has disagreements or complaints regarding a moderator, please submit a ticket on Discord or email contact@milkywayidle.com.
  • Bots, Scripts, and Extensions
    1. No Botting: Do not use any automation that plays the game for you.
    2. Scripts and Extensions: Any scripts or extensions must not take any actions for the player (send any requests to server). You are allowed to use them purely for information display purposes or UI improvements. (ex: Display combat summary, track drops, move buttons to different location)
  • Bugs and Exploits
    1. No Bug Abusing: Do not abuse game bugs or exploits to your advantage. Please report them on Discord.
